title: User Signup and Club Creation with President Role Assignment
description: Verify that a new user can successfully sign up, create a club, and is assigned the president role automatically.

steps.description: Navigate to the signup page.
Enter valid user details and submit the signup form.
Check that the user account is created and club creation flow is initiated.
Verify that the new club is created in the system.
Confirm the user is assigned the president role for the newly created club.

title: Member Application via Club Code and Approval Workflow
description: Validate that prospective members can apply for club membership using a unique club code and that presidents or vice-presidents can approve or reject applications with proper notifications.

steps.description: Navigate to the member application page.
Enter a valid club code and applicant details.
Submit the membership application.
Verify application is recorded and notification is sent to the club's president/vice-president.
Login as president or vice-president and navigate to membership requests.
Approve the membership application.
Confirm the applicant's status changes to approved and notification is sent to the applicant.
Attempt to apply with an invalid or expired club code.
Ensure application fails and appropriate error message is displayed.

title: Role-Based Access Control Enforcement
description: Ensure that role-based permissions enforce access and UI gating correctly for different user roles such as president, vice-president, member, and guest.

steps.description: Login as a user with president role.
Verify access to all president-only and shared club management features.
Login as a user with vice-president role.
Verify access to vice-president permitted features and denied access to president-only functions.
Login as a regular member.
Verify access is restricted according to member permissions and UI elements for restricted areas are hidden or disabled.
Attempt to access restricted API endpoints with insufficient permissions.
Confirm access is denied and proper error responses are returned.

title: Event Creation, Status Management, and Budget Planning
description: Test event creation flow including input validation, status tracking, budget planning, and event editing capabilities.

steps.description: Login as a user with event creation permission.
Navigate to event management section and create a new event with mandatory fields and budget.
Verify the event is created successfully with status set as planned.
Edit the event to update its status to in-progress and adjust the budget.
Confirm status and budget changes are reflected correctly.
Attempt to create an event with missing required information.
Ensure validation errors are displayed preventing event creation.

title: AI-Powered Task Generation and Suggestions for Events
description: Validate AI task generation for events, ensuring the system requires valid API keys and generates relevant and meaningful tasks.

steps.description: Login and create or select an event for AI task generation.
Trigger AI task generation with valid Groq and Google Gemini API keys.
Check that AI generates relevant task suggestions associated with the event.
Attempt AI task generation without valid API keys.
Verify system blocks task generation and returns an appropriate error message.

title: Task Management: Creation, Assignment, Lifecycle Tracking
description: Ensure tasks can be created, assigned to members or teams, edited, and tracked through all lifecycle statuses.

steps.description: Navigate to task management section.
Create new tasks with all required fields including assignee (member or team) and due dates.
Verify tasks appear in the assigned user or team task list.
Update task statuses through stages: pending, in-progress, completed.
Confirm task lifecycle status updates correctly and triggers any relevant notifications.
Attempt to assign a task to a non-existent member or team.
Ensure task assignment is rejected with clear error messages.

title: Financial Transaction Tracking with Approvals and Receipt Uploads
description: Validate that financial transactions can be added with receipt uploads, approval workflows function, and data can be exported.

steps.description: Login as a user authorized to add financial transactions.
Add a financial transaction including required fields and upload a digital receipt.
Verify the transaction is saved with receipt link accessible.
Submit the transaction for approval.
Login as an authorized approver and approve the submitted transaction.
Confirm status changes to approved and notifications are sent.
Export the financial transactions report.
Verify export file downloads correctly and contains accurate data.
Attempt an unauthorized user to add or approve transactions.
Confirm access is denied and error messages are displayed.

title: Social Media Post Creation, Scheduling, Multi-Platform Posting, and Status Tracking
description: Test the workflow for creating social media content, scheduling posts for publication across multiple platforms, and verifying status updates and monitoring.

steps.description: Navigate to social media management module.
Create a new social media post with content and select target platforms.
Schedule the post for a future date and time.
Verify post appears in the schedule with correct platforms and status as pending.
Simulate passage of scheduled time or trigger immediate posting.
Confirm post is published successfully on all selected platforms and status updates to posted.
Attempt to schedule a post with invalid or missing content.
Verify validation errors prevent scheduling.

title: Institution Mode: Multi-Club Management, Analytics, Department Organization, Reporting
description: Verify that institution mode users can create and manage multiple clubs, organize departments, view analytics, and generate centralized reports.

steps.description: Login as an institution administrator.
Create multiple clubs under the institution entity.
Verify clubs are created and listed under institution control.
Organize clubs into departments.
Confirm department organization reflects correctly in UI and data.
Access analytics dashboard showing multi-club aggregated data.
Verify analytics data is accurate and up to date.
Generate and export reports summarizing club activities and metrics.
Confirm reports contain expected information and export correctly.

title: Authentication and Session Management with JWT Token Validation and Expiry Handling
description: Test the authentication system ensuring secure login, JWT session management with correct token validation, expiry, and renewal.

steps.description: Attempt login with valid credentials.
Confirm successful authentication and receipt of valid JWT token.
Access protected routes with valid token.
Verify access granted and data returned correctly.
Simulate token expiry by using an expired JWT token.
Confirm access is denied and user is prompted for re-authentication.
Attempt login with invalid credentials.
Ensure login fails with appropriate error message and no token issued.

title: Frontend UI Responsiveness and Accessibility Across Devices
description: Validate that the ClubCentral UI is responsive and accessible across different devices and screen sizes, meeting modern accessibility standards.

steps.description: Open the application dashboard page in desktop, tablet, and mobile screen resolutions.
Verify UI components resize and rearrange correctly without content overlap or cutoff.
Use keyboard navigation to access all interactive elements.
Confirm all controls are accessible and focus is handled correctly.
Run accessibility audit tools to check color contrast, ARIA labels, and semantic markup.
Ensure no critical accessibility violations are present.

title: Backend API Endpoint Authentication, Authorization, and Error Handling
description: Test that all backend API endpoints enforce authentication, authorization per user role, and handle errors gracefully with appropriate status codes and messages.

steps.description: Call protected API endpoints without authentication token.
Verify 401 Unauthorized status is returned.
Call endpoints with valid token but insufficient permissions.
Ensure 403 Forbidden status is returned.
Make API requests with malformed or missing required parameters.
Confirm 400 Bad Request status with descriptive error messages.
Simulate server-side errors such as database failure.
Check API returns 500 Internal Server Error with generic error message.
